div.p: German illustrated music periodical, published by Max Hesse Verlag in Berlin, founded in 1901 by Bernhard Schuster, who edited it until his death in 1934. It was published 1901/02–1914/15, and after a break of eight years, 1922/23 to 1942/43, after which it was absorbed with two other periodicals as a vehicle for the Nazi party under the title Musik im Kriege, edited by Herbert Gerigk (1943/44–1944/45).

div.head: Die Musik and Schenker
div.p: One letter from Schenker to the periodical survives as OJ 5/26 (1911), and six items of correspondence from Bernhard Schuster under the Die Musik letterhead survive as OJ 14/20 (1922â€“25). Schenker contributed one article to it: Joh. Seb. Bach: Wohltemperiertes Klavier, Band I, Präludium c-moll, Die Musik 15/9 (June 1923), pp. 641–51 [appeared subsequently in Das Meisterwerk in der Musik, vol. 2 (1926), as part of Das Organische der Fuge: aufgezeigt an der I. C-Moll-Fuge aus dem Woltemperierten Klavier von Joh. Seb. Bach, pp. 55–95]
